==About OpenNERO==
[http://nn.cs.utexas.edu/?opennero OpenNERO] is an open source software platform designed for research and education in computational intelligence in games. The project is based on the [http://www.nerogame.org/ Neuro-Evolving Robotic Operatives (NERO) game] developed by graduate and undergraduate students at the  [http://nn.cs.utexas.edu/ Neural Networks Research Group] and [http://www.cs.utexas.edu/ Department of Computer Science] at the [http://www.utexas.edu/ University of Texas at Austin].

==Getting started==
You can download a binary build of OpenNERO for your platform, or checkout the current source and build it yourself. Please see BuildingOpenNero for how to build and RunningOpenNero for how to run OpenNERO.
----
==Components==
OpenNERO is built using open source components, including:
 * [http://irrlicht.sourceforge.net/ Irrlicht 3D Engine] - released under the [http://irrlicht.sourceforge.net/license.html Irrlicht Engine License]
 * [http://www.boost.org/ Boost C++ libraries] - governed by the [http://www.boost.org/users/license.html Boost Software License]
 * [http://www.python.org/ Python scripting language] - governed by the [http://www.python.org/psf/license/ Python License]
 * [http://nn.cs.utexas.edu/?rtNEAT rtNEAT algorithm] - created by [http://www.cs.ucf.edu/~kstanley/ Ken Stanley] and [http://www.cs.utexas.edu/~risto/ Risto Miikkulainen] at UT Austin.
